Property settlement deed worth Rs.1,96,000/- dated 22nd January 2026
Signed by: Aguduri Subbamma, wife of Aguduri Tirupal Reddy, aged 49 years,
House No.1-65, G.C. Palem Village, Bandi Atmakur Mandal, Nandyal District.
Written by: Aguduri Mallareddy's son Aguduri Thirupal Reddy, aged 68 years, house no. 1-65, G.C. Palem village, Bandi Atmakur mandal, Nandyal district.
You are my wife, and because of the love I have for you and because I have a desire to give you some property for your life, I have, in consideration of love itself, and without any consideration, given you the property worth Rs. 1,96,000/- in characters as per the following schedule, as a settlement, and have taken possession of the property mentioned below this very day.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 239 of 2026, dated 24/Jan/2026, executed by Aguduri Thirupal Reddy, in favour of his Wife, Aguduri Subbamma, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 49.11Sq.Yds, bearing house number 1-65, Assessment No 75, comprised in survey number 155, situated in Gali Chennaiahpalem Village and Grama Panchayat, Bandi Atmakur Mandal, within the District of Nandyal, registered at sub-registrar office Bandi Atmakur, is bounded as follows: North by: C.C. Road South by: Mallem Pullaiah House East by: C.C. Road West by: Aguduru Chennamma House

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed

Note : It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
